meanings.definition: To deprive of something essential for life or well-being.
meanings.sent1: The cruel landlord was destituting the poor villagers of clean water.
meanings.sent2: The lack of food was destituting the family of their basic needs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was destituting the birds of their precious seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like a thief, destituting the town of its electricity.
meanings.sent5: The relentless drought was slowly destituting the land of its fertility.

meanings.definition: To remove from a position or office.
meanings.sent1: The board of directors was destituting the CEO of his authority.
meanings.sent2: The king was destituting the traitorous minister from his position.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student was jokingly destituting the teacher from her desk.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like a force of nature, destituting the tree from its roots.
meanings.sent5: The sudden scandal was destituting the politician from his power.

meanings.sent1: The economic crisis was destituting many families of their savings.
meanings.sent2: The war was destituting the country of its resources.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun was destituting the town of its gold coins.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like a thief, destituting the land of its lush greenery.
meanings.sent5: The harsh winter was slowly destituting the animals of their warmth.
